## Warm-Up (10 min)

- Bodyweight squats: 2 Ã— 15

| Sets | Reps | Rest | RPE |
|------|------|------|-----|
| 4 | 6â€“8 | 3 min | 7â€“8 |

| 3 | 8â€“10 | 2 min | 7â€“8 |

| 3 | 10 per leg | 90 sec | 8 |

| 3 | 12â€“15 | 60 sec | 8 |

**Cues**: Hips pressed into pad. Curl fully. 2-second negative. Don't let the weight slam.

| Sets | Reps | Rest | RPE |
|------|------|------|-----|
| 4 | 15â€“20 | 45 sec | 8 |

## Program Overview

Welcome to the **February 2026 Hypertrophy Block**. This month focuses on maximizing muscle growth through controlled volume, progressive overload, and strategic exercise selection.

Full Body â€” Explosive Compound Work

## Program Overview

Welcome to the **March 2026 Strength Foundation** block. After last month's hypertrophy focus, we're shifting to heavier loads, lower rep ranges, and longer rest periods to build maximal strength.

## Training Split

| Day | Focus | Intensity |
|-----|-------|-----------|
| Day 1 | Upper Body Strength | High |
| Day 2 | Lower Body Strength | High |
| Day 3 | Full Body Power | Moderateâ€“High |

## Key Principles

- **Heavy Loads**: Working in the 3â€“6 rep range for main lifts
- **Long Rest**: 3â€“5 minutes between heavy compound sets
- **Quality Over Quantity**: Fewer sets, but every rep counts
- **RPE Target**: Main lifts at RPE 8â€“9 (1â€“2 reps in reserve)

## Nutrition Notes

Maintain caloric intake at or slightly above maintenance. Prioritize carbohydrates around training sessions for energy. Keep protein at 0.8â€“1g per pound of body weight.
